page.title: 17Our Visit to Mr Mann
page.content: We went to interview Mr Mann at the {post office.}Mr Mann has lived in Stanton all his life, and he is 72 and a half now. He used to sleep in the same room, but he has moved into the other bedroom. When Mr Mann was 2 and a half, the post office was built. Mrs Mann got 5 shillings a week as{salary for running the post office. Mr Mann had about 1 shilling a month, as {pocket money.}Mr Mann worked in the church nearly seventy years ago. His uncle was verger at the{church}and he had to have special permission from the rector's wife to sit in the pews. His job was chopping wood for the county council. Court Gardens weren't there. The people in the Manor and farmers were the only ones with cars. {The school}has improved, it was just Mrs Banks' room, but an extension was built in 1954.
